abstract.text: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app successfully recreates the specified activity.

inlineContent.text: The app continuing the user activity.
The activity object containing the data associated with the task the user was performing. Use the data in this object to recreate what the user was doing.

A block to execute if your app creates or fetches objects to perform the task. Calling this block is optional and is only needed when specific objects are capable of continuing the activity. You can copy this block and call it at a later time. When calling a saved copy of the block, you must call it from the appâ€™s main thread. This block has no return value and takes the following parameter:
An array of
or
objects that you created or fetched in order to perform the operation. The system calls the
method of each object in the array to perform the operation.
if this method handled continuing the activity;
to have AppKit attempt to continue the activity.
The app calls this method when it receives the data associated with the user activity. Use the data stored in the
object to re-create the userâ€™s activity. This method is your opportunity to update your app so that it can perform the associated task.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that manages an appâ€™s main event loop and resources used by all of that appâ€™s objects.
A set of methods that manage your appâ€™s life cycle and its interaction with common system services.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app successfully recreates the specified activity.
Tells the delegate that the app couldnâ€™t continue the specified activity.
Tells the delegate that there are changes to the specified activity.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app can continue the specified activity.
An abstract class that defines the interface for macOS documents.
An abstract class that forms the basis of event and command processing in AppKit.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
Restores the state necessary to continue the specified user activity.
A representation of the state of your app at a moment in time.
A dictionary containing app-specific state information needed to continue an activity on another device.
A false value.
A true value.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A representation of the state of your app at a moment in time.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that donâ€™t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
